A reproducible example requires:
<U+26AB> Minimal dataset, necessary to demonstrate the problem
<U+26AB> Sample data must be able to replicate the problem
<U+26AB> Packages, R version, and the system it is run on

In this video, I show you how to use the dput function in R, as well as how to take random samples of data, in order to post on Stack Overflow without getting reprimanded!

dput() writes an ASCII text representation of an R object to a file or connection, or uses one to recreate the object.

Also, I show you a cool tip to clean up your messy code.
